Package com.cbfacademy.frugalflyer.flights.airport

Class AirportController

java.lang.Object
com.cbfacademy.frugalflyer.flights.airport.AirportController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/airports") public class AirportController extends Object
Controller class to implement airport API endpoints and handle requests.

  • Method Details

    • deleteAirportByCode

      @DeleteMapping("/{code}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAirportByCode(@PathVariable String code) throws AirportNotFoundException, AirportInUseException
      Deletes specified airport
      Parameters:
      code - Iata code of airport
      Returns:
      reponse body
      Throws:
      AirportNotFoundException - if no airports exist with airport code
      AirportInUseException - if specifed airport's key is being used somewhere else in the database.

    • createNewAirport

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Airport> createNewAirport(@RequestParam String airportCode, @RequestParam String airportName, @RequestParam Long destinationId) throws IllegalArgumentException, org.springframework.dao.OptimisticLockingFailureException
      Add a new airport
      Parameters:
      airport - Airport object to add
      Returns:
      Response entity with body of the created airport
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException
      org.springframework.dao.OptimisticLockingFailureException

    • updateAirport

      @PutMapping public Airport updateAirport(@RequestParam String oldAirportCode, @RequestParam String airportName, @RequestParam Long destinationId) throws AirportNotFoundException, org.springframework.dao.OptimisticLockingFailureException, IllegalArgumentException
      Updates an existing airport. The IATA code will be kept the same.
      Parameters:
      code - IATA code of existing airport
      updatedAirport - new Airport
      Returns:
      updated airport
      Throws:
      AirportNotFoundException
      org.springframework.dao.OptimisticLockingFailureException
      IllegalArgumentException

      @GetMapping("/{code}") public Airport getAirportByCode(@PathVariable String code) throws AirportNotFoundException
      Finds an airport, with the specified code, from the database.
      Parameters:
      code - IATA code of airport
      Returns:
      the airport
      Throws:
      AirportNotFoundException
